results.title: Nvidia Stock Forecast: Bracing for a Pullback Amid AI Headwinds - TipRanks
results.content:
## Financial Strength and Analyst Outlook

Nvidia posted 62% revenue growth to $57.01 billion in its October quarter, with net income up 65% to $31.91 billion. Analysts project fiscal 2026 revenue of over $212 billion, with AI spending set to rise 30% in 2026-2027. A projected $3 trillion global data center wave further cements long-term demand for GPUs.

## Is NVDA a Strong Buy?

Analysts remain highly optimistic about Nvidia’s long-term outlook. On TipRanks, NVDA stock commands a Strong Buy consensus rating based on 38 Buys, one Hold, and one Sell rating. The average Nvidia price target of $262.79 implies 37.5% upside potential from current levels. Over the past year, NVDA stock has surged 63.8%.

See more NVDA analyst ratings

Disclaimer & DisclosureReport an Issue

1 [...] Sheryl ShethFeb 02, 2026, 07:17 PM

Nvidia’s (NVDA) dominance in artificial intelligence (AI) chips faces growing challenges that could weigh on its stock price in 2026. As the AI sector’s bellwether, Nvidia’s shares have dropped 7.6% over the past three months, outpacing the Nasdaq’s (NDX) 1.6% decline. Currently trading around $191, the stock has pulled back from its 52-week high of $212.

This table illustrates how NVDA is valued compared to the broader market. For additional information see: NVDA Valuation Ratios [...] 2022 Inflation Shock

 NVDA stock declined by 66.4% from a high of $33.38 on 29 November 2021 to $11.23 on 14 October 2022 compared to a peak-to-trough decrease of 25.4% for the S&P 500.
 However, the stock fully rebounded to its pre-Crisis high by 25 May 2023
 Since then, the stock has climbed to a peak of $207.04 on 29 October 2025, and is currently trading at $185.61

2020 Covid Pandemic

 NVDA stock saw a drop of 37.6% from a peak of $7.87 on 19 February 2020 to $4.91 on 16 March 2020 compared to a peak-to-trough decline of 33.9% for the S&P 500.
 However, the stock completely recovered to its pre-Crisis peak by 11 May 2020

2008 Global Financial Crisis [...] Growth Is Very Strong

 NVIDIA has experienced its top-line grow at an average rate of 91.6% over the past 3 years
 Its revenues have increased by 65% from $113 Bil to $187 Bil in the last 12 months
 Additionally, its quarterly revenues rose by 62.5% to $57 Bil in the latest quarter from $35 Bil a year ago.

# Nvidia Stock Investors Got Great News From Palantir and Teradyne

ByBeth McKenna – Feb 3, 2026 at 9:09PM EST

## NASDAQ: NVDA

### Nvidia

Market Cap

Today's Change

(-2.82%) $5.23

Current Price

$180.38 [...] Avg Vol

3.2M

Gross Margin

57.96%

Dividend Yield

0.17%

In Q4, Teradyne's revenue jumped 44% year over year to $1.08 billion, driven by strong demand for its testing equipment for AI-related chips, both compute (the category that includes the GPUs that Nvidia designs) and memory (Nvidia buys memory chips for integration with its GPUs for its AI data center chips). Adjusted EPS soared 89% year over year to $1.80, crushing the $1.38 Wall Street had expected.

CEO Greg Smith said, "In 2026, we expect year-over-year growth across all of our businesses, with strong momentum in compute driven by AI."

Teradyne stock rocketed 13.4% on Tuesday.

## Nvidia reports its quarterly earnings on Feb. 25 [...] Volume

140K

Avg Vol

46M

Gross Margin

82.37%

In the fourth quarter, Palantir's revenue soared 70% year over year to $1.41 billion. Growth was driven by U.S. commercial revenue skyrocketing 137% to $507 million and U.S. government revenue jumping 66% to $570 million. Adjusted earnings per share (EPS) surged 79% to 0.25.

Moreover, management provided 2026 revenue guidance of 61% annual growth.

The quarter's results and guidance easily beat Wall Street's estimates.

Palantir stock jumped 6.8% on Tuesday.

## Teradyne's quarterly results

Teradyne's largest business is making testing equipment for semiconductors (or chips). Management attributed its robust results to strong demand for AI-related chips.
